New Records: Corey Seager hit the hardest World Series homer in the Statcast era with a speed of 114.5 mph.
Texas Rangers improved to 9-0 in the postseason and 9-0 on the road
Key Match Events: Corey Seager made a sliding stop and started a double play in the eighth inning.
Emmanuel Rivera led off the eighth with a double, and Geraldo Perdomo followed with an RBI single.
Max Scherzer left the game due to back tightness but the Rangers' bullpen held the Diamondbacks offense quiet.
Pre-Game Insights: Texas Rangers had a 9-0 record in the postseason when scoring first.
Post-Match Reflections: Corey Seager expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Adolis Garc√≠a's injury and the team's depth were discussed by Marcus Semien.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first at Chase Field since 2001.
Texas rookie Evan Carter became the fourth-youngest player to hit cleanup in a World Series game.
Others: The Rangers won 41 of the 62 previous instances when the World Series was tied 1-1 after Game 2.
The Diamondbacks had not lost at home in the World Series since 2001.
